intro: Cerinthe major var. purpurascens, commonly known as the purple-flowered horned poppy, is a striking member of the Papaveraceae family. It is native to southern Europe and thrives in sunny, well-drained soils. The plant features showy, spurred flowers that range from pink to deep purple, with prominent, horn-like structures at the base of the petals. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This annual plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and wildflower displays.
